H0.text: Proxima Centauri is the star nearest the Earth.

H1.text: Apollinaris Centauri is the star nearest the Earth.

H2.text: Andromeda Centauri is the star nearest the Earth.

H3.text: Alpha Centauri is the star nearest the Earth.

A4.text: Proxima Centauri, the nearest star to Earth after the Sun, is located 4.25 light-years (1.3 parsecs) away in the southern constellation of Centaurus.

A5.text: Proxima Centauri is a member of the Alpha Centauri star system, being identified as component Alpha Centauri C, and is 2.18Â° to the southwest of the Alpha Centauri AB pair.
